intro: Chelidonium sutchuenense, commonly known as the Sichuan poppy, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Sichuan, China. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family, which includes other well-known species such as the opium poppy. The plant features striking orange-red flowers that bloom in the spring, and its leaves are typically lobed and somewhat hairy. It thrives in rocky or well-drained soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
